isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM WITH TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - 9200, 9300 and 9400 - ADJUSTMENT

svcsubsecinfo.para: The only adjustment on the ABS system is to the sensors. When reinstalling the hubs to the front axle (less the brake drums), adjust the wheel bearings.

Refer to GROUP 02 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for bearing adjustment information. Install the sensors one per each side. Install the brake drums after the inspection is complete. Refer to GROUP 14 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for rear brake drum installation information.

svcproc.title: WHEEL SENSORS
svcproc.para: To adjust the wheel sensors, push the sensor into the bushing (on front axle) or into the mounting block (rear axle) as far as it will go. The sensor will bottom out against the exciter ring, then as the exciter ring rotates, the sensor will self-adjust. To adjust or check adjustment of the rear wheel sensor, the brake drum must be removed. Inspect for runout as described in EXCITER RINGS.
